          <h2>
           Search Google Scholar for Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_20" id="content10101170">
          <div id="boxatt10101170" class="boxatt">
           <label for="searchText10101170">
            <img alt="Google Scholar Logo" src="http://lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/google_scholar.jpg" />
           </label>
           <br />
           <input type="text" value="" id="searchText10101170" class="google_search_box" title="Google scholar search" />
           <br />
           <input type="button" onclick="var queryString = document.getElementById('searchText10101170').value;queryString = queryString.replace(/\\+/g, '+');var url = 'http://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=' + queryString;window.open(url,'GScholar');" value="Search" />
          </div>

     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:520px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox18322175">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18322175">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18322175">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Player Piano (ongoing events)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18322175">
          <p>
           <span style="font-weight: bold;">
            Works about
            <em>
             Player Piano
            </em>
           </span>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Barber, Benjamin R., and Michael J. Gargas McGrath, eds.
            <em>
             The Artist and Political Vision
            </em>
            . New Brunswick: Transaction, 1982.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1002661">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 809 A791
            </a>
            <br />
            <span style="font-style: italic;">
             *See chapter titled: &ldquo;Kesey and Vonnegut: The Critique of Liberal Democracy in Contemporary Literature.&rdquo;
            </span>
           </p>
           <p>
            Giannone, Richard.
            <em>
             Vonnegut: A Preface to His Novels
            </em>
            . Port Washington, NY: National University Publications, 1977.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1099106">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 813.54 V947zg
            </a>
            <br />
            <span style="font-style: italic;">
             *See chapter about Player Piano.
            </span>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Literature Criticism Online
            </em>
            database
            <br />
            Subscribed to by Muhlenberg College, at
            <a href="http://0-infotrac.galegroup.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/itweb/mul_coll?db=LCO">
             http://0-infotrac.galegroup.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/itweb/mul_coll?db=LCO
            </a>
            .
            <br />
            Go to: Advanced Search. Search on:
            <em>
             Player piano (full text)
            </em>
            AND
            <em>
             Vonnegut (named author)
            </em>
           </p>
           <p>
            Lundquist, James.
            <em>
             Kurt Vonnegut
            </em>
            . New York: Ungar, 1977.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1049463">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 813.54 V947zl
            </a>
            <br />
            <span style="font-style: italic;">
             *Several pages on Player Piano. See index.
            </span>
           </p>
           <p>
            Marvin, Thomas F.
            <em>
             Kurt Vonnegut: A Critical Companion.
            </em>
            Westport, CT: Greenwood, 2002.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1700211">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 813.54 V947zma
            </a>
            <br />
            <span style="font-style: italic;">
             *Contains a chapter devoted to Player Piano.
            </span>
           </p>
           <p>
            Mustazza, Leonard.
            <em>
             Forever Pursuing Genesis: The Myth of Eden in the Novels of Kurt Vonnegut
            </em>
            . Lewisburg PA : Bucknell University Press, 1990.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1711643">
             Trexler Library -- copy on order
            </a>
            <br />
            <span style="font-style: italic;">
             *See chapter about Player Piano.
            </span>
           </p>
           <p>
            Mustazza, Leonard. &ldquo;The Machine Within: Mechanization, Human Discontent, and the Genre of Vonnegut's Player Piano.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Papers on Language and Literature: A Journal for Scholars and Critics of Language and Literature
            </em>
            , 1989 Winter; 25 (1): 99-113.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=mzh&amp;AN=1989095517&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed June 29, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            Rabkin, Eric S., Martin H. Greenberg, and Joseph D. Olander, eds.
            <em>
             No Place Else: Explorations in Utopian and Dystopian Fiction
            </em>
            . Carbondale: Southern Illinois UP, 1983.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1063688">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 823.09 N739
            </a>
            <br />
            <span style="font-style: italic;">
             *See chapter titled: &ldquo;Vonnegut&rsquo;s Player Piano: An Ambiguous Technological Dystopia.
            </span>
            &rdquo;
           </p>
           <p>
            Roemer, Kenneth M. ed.
            <em>
             America
            </em>
            <em>
             as Utopia
            </em>
            . New York: Franklin, 1981.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1115334">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 813.09 A5121
            </a>
            <br />
            <span style="font-style: italic;">
             *See chapter titled: &ldquo;The Ghost in the Machine: The Theme of Player Piano.&rdquo;
            </span>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p style="font-weight: bold;">
           Works about the author Kurt Vonnegut
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Reed, Peter J. and Marc Leeds, eds.
            <em>
             The
            </em>
            <em>
             Vonnegut
            </em>
            <strong>
            </strong>
            <em>
             Chronicles:
            </em>
            <em>
             Interviews
            </em>
            <strong>
            </strong>
            <em>
             and Essays
            </em>
            . Westport, CT: Greenwood, 1996.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1711613">
             Trexler Library -- copy on order
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Vonnegut, Kurt.
            <em>
             A Man Without a Country
            </em>
            . New York: Random House, 2007.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1590418">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 813.54 V947m
            </a>
            <br />
            <span style="font-style: italic;">
             *An illuminating series of mini-memoirs.
            </span>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt18322175" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18322184">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18322184">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18322184">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Robert Musil (September 9)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18322184">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Robert Musil
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Amnesty--What Kind and When?&rdquo;
            <em>
             The Nation
            </em>
            218, 16 (20 April 1974): 497-500.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1061494">
             Trexler Library Periodicals
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            "Focus on Health." In
            <em>
             Ignition: What You Can Do to Fight Global Warming and Spark a Movement
            </em>
            , edited by J. Isham and S. Waage. Washington, DC: Island Press, 2007.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1720983">
             Trexler Library -- copy on order
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Hope for a Heated Planet: How Americans Are Fighting Global Warming and Building a Better Future
            </em>
            . New Brunswick, NJ: Rutgers University Press, 2009.
            <br />
            Trexler Library -- copy on order (
            <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Hope-Heated-Planet-Americans-Fighting/dp/0813544114/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&amp;s=books&amp;qid=1214930368&amp;sr=8-1">
             forthcoming
            </a>
            )
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Learning to Love the Bomb.&rdquo;
            <em>
             The Nation
            </em>
            278, no. 12 (29 March 2004), 2, 23.
            <a href="http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/hww/jumpstart.jhtml?recid=0bc05f7a67b1790e3e62fef736e0394d763f094b2f35eaa0281719517372617e0d9fb5d165d0b442&amp;fmt=H">
             http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed June 24, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Nuclear Energy, All Things Considered
            <em>
             .&rdquo;
            </em>
            With Eugene A. Rosa, Donna C. King, Jack Steinberger &amp; Helmut Hirsch,
            <strong>
            </strong>
            <em>
             The
             <strong>
             </strong>
            </em>
            <em>
             Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists
            </em>
            64, no. 1 (March/April 2008), 4-5.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=32587059&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed June 21, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;People Power.&rdquo;
            <em>
             The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists
            </em>
            60, no. 1 (January/February 2004), 69-70.
            <a href="http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/hww/jumpstart.jhtml?recid=0bc05f7a67b1790e3e62fef736e0394d763f094b2f35eaa0847be5cd4936816a49939179ea892f94&amp;fmt=H">
             http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed June 24, 2008).
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Robert Musil
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            &ldquo;14 Conservation CEOs Protest Proposed Parkland Cuts To Gingrich.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Defenders of Wildlife
            </em>
            . 24 May 1996.
            <a href="http://tinyurl.com/5aghbb">
             http://tinyurl.com/5aghbb
            </a>
            (accessed June 24, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            Government Affairs Program. &ldquo;Summary of Briefings on Climate Change (10-4-02).&rdquo;
            <em>
             American Geological Institute.
            </em>
            <a href="http://www.agiweb.org/gap/legis107/climate_briefings.html">
             http://www.agiweb.org/gap/legis107/climate_briefings.html
            </a>
            (accessed June 24, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            "Woodrow Wilson Visiting Fellows Program: Robert K. Musil."
            <a href="http://www.cic.edu/projects_services/visitingfellows/visiting_fellows_bios.asp#MUSIL">
             http://www.cic.edu/projects_services/visitingfellows/visiting_fellows_bios.asp#MUSIL
            </a>
            (accessed July 24, 2008).
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about global environmental politics
           </strong>

          <h2>
           Guillermo Gómez-Peña (September 11)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18322193">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Guillermo G&oacute;mez-Pe&ntilde;a
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             Codex Espangliensis: From Columbus to the Border Patrol,
            </em>
            with Enrique Chagoya &amp; Felicia Rice
            <em>
             .
            </em>
            San Francisco: City Lights Books, 2000.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1666519">
             Trexler Library -- copy in process
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Dangerous Border Crossers: The Artist Talks Back.
            </em>
            London; New York: Routledge, 2000.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1427989">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 818.54 G633d
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
            </em>
            <em>
             Ethno-techno: Writings on Performance, Activism, and Pedagogy,
            </em>
            with Elaine Pena
            <em>
             .
            </em>
            New York: Routledge, 2005.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1666520">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 700 G633et
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
            </em>
            <em>
             &ldquo;
            </em>
            Guillermo Gomez
            <em>
             -
            </em>
            Pena.&rdquo;
            <strong>
            </strong>
            <em>
             Art Journal
            </em>
            51, 4 (Winter 1992), 8.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=9301190090&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed June 21, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
            </em>
            <em>
             Temple
            </em>
            <em>
             of Confessions: Mexican Beasts and Living Santos
            </em>
            , with Roberto Sifuentes &amp; Philip Brookman. New York: Powerhouse Books, 1996.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1668044">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 709.2 G633t
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             The New World Border: Prophecies, Poems, &amp; Loqueras for the End of the Century.
            </em>
            San Francisco: City Lights, 1996.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1666518">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 818.5409 G633n
            </a>

            &ldquo;[THE] Old Neighborhood.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Inc.
            </em>
            22, 7 (2000), 103-105.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=3151201&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed June 21, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Warrior for Gringostroika: Essays, Performance Texts, and Poetry,
            </em>
            with Roger Barta
            <em>
             .
            </em>
            St. Paul, MN: Graywolf Press, 1993.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1099565">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 818.54 G663w
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>

          <h2>
           Peter Beinart (September 16)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18322201">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Peter Beinart
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            &ldquo;A Different Country.&rdquo;
            <em>
             New Republic
            </em>
            236, no. 10/11 (5 March 2007), 6.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=24228639&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">

            </em>

           </p>

            </em>

           </p>

            <em>

            </em>

            </a>

           </p>

            </em>

           </p>

          <h2>
           William Gamson (September 22)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18322238">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by William Gamson
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             Encounters with Unjust Authority.
            </em>
            With Bruce Fireman &amp; Steve Rytina. Homewood, IL: Dorsey Press, 1982.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1024805">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 303.36 G194e
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Knowing Your Adversary: Israeli Structure of Political Opportunity and the Inception of the Palestinian Intifada.&rdquo; With Eitan Alimi &amp; Charlotte Ryan.
            <em>
             Sociological Forum
            </em>
            21, no. 4 (December 2006), 535-557.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=23444639&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed June 24, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Movements and Media as Interacting Systems.&rdquo; With Gadi Wolfsfeld. In
            <em>
             Citizens, protest, and democracy,
            </em>
            ed. Russell J. Dalton, 114-125. Newbury Park, CA: Sage Publications, 1993.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1012209">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 305 A512a, v.528
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;On a Sociology of the Media.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Political Communication
            </em>
            21, no. 3 (July-September 2004), 305-307.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=13986257&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed June 24, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Power and Discontent
            </em>
            . Homewood, IL: Dorsey Press, 1968.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1072933">

            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Promoting Political Engagement.&rdquo; In
            <em>
             Mediated Politics: Communication in the Future of Democracy,
            </em>
            ed. W. Lance Bennett &amp; Robert M. Entman, 56-74. Cambridge, U.K. &amp; New York: Cambridge University Press, 2001.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1667619">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 320.014 M489p.
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             SIMSOC: Simulated Society: Participant&rsquo;s Manual with Selected Readings
            </em>
            . New York: Free Press, 1972.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1085114">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 301.15 G194s
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about William Gamson
           </strong>
          </p>

          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Peter Brookes (September 24)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18322258">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Peter Brookes
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             A Devil&rsquo;s Triangle: Terrorism, Weapons of Mass Destruction, and Rogue States
            </em>
            . Lanham: Rowman &amp; Littlefield, 2005.
            <br />
            Trexler Library -- copy on order

           <p>

          </div>
          <h2>
           Kjellgren Alkire (October 3)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18322281">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Kjellgren Alkire (exhibitions)
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            2006 -- Rockin&rsquo;Horse vs. the Rodeo. Mobile Rezurrection Gallery, Phoenix, AZ.
           </p>
           <p>
            2006 -- Jesus Rodeo: An Interactive Installation. Henry Gonzalez Convention Center, San Antonio, TX.
           </p>
           <p>
            2006 -- HeartDetour (Phoenix ArtDetour). Modified Gallery, Phoenix, AZ.
           </p>
           <p>
            2006 -- Ash Wednesday Mourning, Interactive 7-hour Public Performance. Neeb Plaza, Tempe, AZ.
           </p>
           <p>
            2005 -- Advent Project, A Multi-Sensory Liturgical Collaboration. Living Word Lutheran Church, Katy, TX.
           </p>
           <p>
            2005 -- Cootiecatcher vs. Calamity: An Investigation of Certainty, Security and the Sublime. Ylvisaker Fine Arts Center, Bethany Lutheran College, Mankato, MN.
           </p>
           <p>
            2004 -- Heartbreak: An Interactive Installation Investigating Love, Loss &amp; Liturgy. Louvin Gallery, House of Mercy, St Paul, MN.
           </p>
           <p>
            2003 -- Buildings, Bodies, Botany: Twelve Monoprints &amp; Digital Photography. Clown Lounge Gallery, Turf Club, St Paul, MN.
           </p>
           <p>
            2002 -- Logos: Thirty Screenprints &amp; Drawings. Dreamcoat Gallery, Stillwater, MN.
           </p>
           <p>
            2001 -- Remarkable: Twelve Monoprints &amp; Drawings. Nina&rsquo;s Gallery, St Paul, MN.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Kjellgren Alkire

          <h2>
           Gary Jacobson (October 7)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18322309">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Gary Jacobson
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <i>
             A divider, not a uniter: George W. Bush and the American people
            </i>
            . Great questions in politics series. New York: Pearson Longman, 2007.

            <em>

            </a>

            </em>

            </a>

            </em>

          <h2>

          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Sidney Milkis, Shelley Wilcox, &amp; Lisa Bowleg (October 20)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18322368">
          <p>
           <strong>
            SIDNEY MILKIS
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Sidney Milkis
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             The American Presidency: Origins and Development, 1776-1990
            </em>
            . Washington, DC: CQ Press, 1990.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1116368">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 353.0313 M664am
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;The History of the Presidency.&rdquo; In
            <em>
             Guide to the Presidency
            </em>
            , vol. 1, 2nd ed., ed. Michael Nelson, 61-162. Washington, DC: Congressional Quarterly, 1996.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1353502">
             Trexler Library Reference Collection 353.0313 C749g
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Partisan Rancor and Representative Democracy.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Chronicle of Higher Education
            </em>
            52, no. 26 (2 March 2007), B6-B9.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=24281137&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed June 26, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             The President and the Parties: The Transformation of the American Party S
            </em>
            <em>
             ystem Since the New Deal
            </em>
            . New York: Oxford University Press, 1993.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1108353">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 324.273 M664p
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Sidney Milkis
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Brand, Donald R. &ldquo;Icons of Democracy.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Political Science Quarterly
            </em>
            109 (Winter 1994/1995), 895-902.
            <a href="http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/hww/jumpstart.jhtml?recid=0bc05f7a67b1790e3e62fef736e0394d654a0a2640a78688519b8e1127579db553b188ec9a1c70de&amp;fmt=H">
             http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed June 29, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Sidney Milkis.&rdquo;
            <em>
             The Woodrow Wilson Department of Politics at the University of Virginia.
            </em>
            2008.
            <a href="http://www.virginia.edu/politics/staff/scholars/milkis.html">
             http://www.virginia.edu/politics/staff/scholars/milkis.html
            </a>
            (accessed June 26, 2008).
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about American presidency and American politics and elections
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Campbell, James E.
            <em>
             The American Campaign: U.S. Presidential Campaigns and the National Vote
            </em>
            . College Station, TX: A &amp; M University Press, 2000.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1408872">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 324.70973 C188a
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Cronin, Thomas E. &amp; Michael A. Genovese.
            <em>
             The Paradoxes of the American Presidency.
            </em>
            New York: Oxford University Press, 2004.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1471739">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 352.230973 C947p
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Sabato, Larry J. &amp; Howard R. Ernst.
            <em>
             Encyclopedia of American Political Parties and Election
            </em>
            s. New York: Facts on File, 2006.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1591981">
             Trexler Library Reference Collection 324.273 S113e
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <hr align="center" noshade="noshade" size="1" width="50%" />
          <p>
           <strong>
            SHELLEY WILCOX
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Shelley Wilcox
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Culture, National Identity, and Admission to Citizenship.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Social Theory &amp; Practice
            </em>
            30, no. 4 (October 2004): 559-582.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=14902576&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site%20">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Feminism and citizenship, by Voet Rian.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Ethics
            </em>
            110, no. 3 (April 2000): 643-645.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=3478275&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed July 21, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Immigrant Admissions and Global Relations of Harm.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Journal of Social Philosophy
            </em>
            38, no. 2 (Summer 2007): 274-291.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=24987795&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Shelley Wilcox
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            &ldquo;San Francisco State University Department of Philosophy -- Faculty -- Shelley Wilcox."
            <a href="http://www.sfsu.edu/%7Ephlsphr/Shelley_Wilcox.html">
             http://www.sfsu.edu/~phlsphr/Shelley_Wilcox.html
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Symposium Takes on Tough Issues in Immigration.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Sacramento State News
            </em>
            , October 18, 2006.
            <a href="http://www.csus.edu/news/101806Symposiumr.stm">
             http://www.csus.edu/news/101806Symposiumr.stm
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about citizenship, feminist philosophy and applied ethics
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Cohen, Andrew I. &amp; Christopher Heath Wellman, eds.
            <em>
             Contemporary Debates in Applied Ethics
            </em>
            . Malden, MA: Blackwell Publishing, 2005.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1511396">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 170 C878c
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Pearsall, Marilyn, ed.
            <em>
             Women and Values: Readings in Recent Feminist Philosoph
            </em>
            y. Belmont, CA: Wadsworth Publishing, 1999.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1521318">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 305.4201 P361w
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            S.W.A.P.
            <em>
             The Society for Women&rsquo;s Advancement in Philosophy
            </em>
            .
            <a href="http://swapusa.org/">
             http://swapusa.org/
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            Shildrick, Margrit. &ldquo;Reappraising Feminist Ethics: Developments and Debates.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Feminist Theory
            </em>
            2 (August 2001): 233-244.
            <a href="http://0-fty.sagepub.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/cgi/reprint/2/2/233">
             http://0-fty.sagepub.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <hr align="center" noshade="noshade" size="1" width="50%" />
          <p>
           <strong>
            LISA BOWLEG
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Lisa Bowleg
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Gender Roles, Power Strategies, and Precautionary Sexual Self-efficacy: Implications for Black and Latina Women's HIV/AIDS Protective Behaviors.&rdquo; w ith Faye Z. Belgrave and Carol A. Reisen.
            <em>
             Sex Roles
            </em>
            42, no. 7/8 (April 2000): 613-635.
            <a href="http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu:80/hww/jumpstart.jhtml?recid=0bc05f7a67b1790e3e62fef736e0394d763f094b2f35eaa0a4f46ea679b6cdb6f51e66687fa36ca5&amp;fmt=P">
             http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu:80/
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Love, Sex, and Masculinity in Sociocultural Context: HIV Concerns and Condom Use Among African American Men in Heterosexual Relationships.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Men and Masculinities
            </em>
            7 (October 2004): 166-186.
            <a href="http://0-jmm.sagepub.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/cgi/reprint/7/2/166">
             http://0-jmm.sagepub.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Varying Angles and Wider Lenses: A Multicultural Transformation of the Undergraduate Social Psychology Course.&rdquo; In
            <em>
             Teaching Gender and Multicultural Awareness: Resources from the Psychology Classroom
            </em>
            , eds. Phyllis Bronstein &amp; Kathryn Quina. Washington, DC: American Psychological Association, 2003.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1590422">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 150.71 T253g
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Lisa Bowleg
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Lisa Bowleg, PhD -- Drexel University School of Public Health."
            <a href="http://publichealth.drexel.edu/Academics/Faculty_Staff/Lisa_Bowleg_PhD/301/">
             http://publichealth.drexel.edu/Academics/Faculty_Staff/Lisa_Bowleg_PhD/301/
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about GLBT minorities
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            McShee, Sean. &ldquo;Can Biology Vanquish Bigotry?&rdquo;
            <em>
             Gay &amp; Lesbian Review Worldwide
            </em>
            15 (Jan/Feb 2008): 27-29.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=28059615&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
           <p>
            Meyer, Ilan H. and Mary E. Northridge, eds.
            <em>
             The Health of Sexual Minorities: Public Health Perspectives on Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender Populations.
            </em>
            New York: Springer, 2007.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=1658216">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 361.10866 H434o
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Sepulveda, David. &ldquo;The Other 10%.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Advocate
            </em>
            (June 24, 2003): 50-52, 54, 57-58, 60, 62-62.
            <a href="http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/hww/jumpstart.jhtml?recid=0bc05f7a67b1790e3e62fef736e0394d763f094b2f35eaa03a085e8a4b6cdf034162440b2ae163ce&amp;fmt=P">
             http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu:80/P
            </a>
            (accessed July 20, 2008).
           </p>
          </blockquote>
